com.xatkit.core.recognition.regex

Class RegExIntentRecognitionProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xatkit.core.recognition.regex.RegExIntentRecognitionProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IntentRecognitionProvider

    public class RegExIntentRecognitionProvider
extends Object
implements IntentRecognitionProvider
    A default IntentRecognitionProvider that relies on RegExp to match user inputs.

    This intent provider is designed to handle bot prototyping with a minimal support to match user inputs using RegExp Patterns. This provider should not be used if advanced input extraction capabilities are required.

    Note: this class uses strict patterns that perform exact matches of the input. This exact matching is case sensitive. You can check alternative IntentRecognitionProviders if you need to support advanced features such as partial matches.

    Note: the RegExIntentRecognitionProvider translates EntityTypes into single-word patterns. This means that the any entity will match "test", but not "test test", you can check alternative IntentRecognitionProviders if you need to support such features.

    The RegExIntentRecognitionProvider will be used by Xatkit if the application's Configuration file does not contain specific IntentRecognitionProvider properties (see IntentRecognitionProviderFactory.getIntentRecognitionProvider(XatkitCore, Configuration)).

    See Also:
    IntentRecognitionProviderFactory

      • intentPatterns

        protected Map<com.xatkit.intent.IntentDefinition,List<Pattern>> intentPatterns
        The Map used to store RegExp Patterns associated to the registered IntentDefinition.

        Patterns in this map are iterated when an input is received to retrieve the corresponding IntentDefinition. Note that the stored Patterns are strict and match exactly the training sentence used to create them.

      • registerIntentDefinition

        public void registerIntentDefinition(com.xatkit.intent.IntentDefinition intentDefinition)
        Registers the provided IntentDefinition.

        This method creates a set of RegExp patterns that can be matched against user inputs. Note that CustomEntityDefinition used in the provided intentDefinition must have been registered using registerEntityDefinition(EntityDefinition).

        Specified by:
        registerIntentDefinition in interface IntentRecognitionProvider
        Parameters:
        intentDefinition - the IntentDefinition to register to the underlying intent recognition provider
        See Also:

      • deleteIntentDefinition

        public void deleteIntentDefinition(com.xatkit.intent.IntentDefinition intentDefinition)
        Deletes the provided intentDefinition.

        This method deletes the RegExp Patterns associated to the provided intentDefinition, meaning that the intent won't be matched by the provider anymore.

        Specified by:
        deleteIntentDefinition in interface IntentRecognitionProvider
        Parameters:

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the intent recognition provider client and invalidates the remaining sessions.

        Note: calling this method invalidates the intent recognition provider client connection, and thus this class cannot be used to access the intent recognition provider anymore.

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface IntentRecognitionProvider

        Returns whether the intent recognition provider client is shutdown.
        Specified by:
        isShutdown in interface IntentRecognitionProvider
        Returns:

      • getIntent

        public com.xatkit.intent.RecognizedIntent getIntent(String input,
                                                    XatkitSession session)
        Computes the RecognizedIntent associated to the provided input.

        This method relies on the RegExp patterns created when calling registerIntentDefinition(IntentDefinition) to match the provided input. The provided session is used to retrieve the intents that can be matched according to the current contexts.

        If the RegExIntentRecognitionProvider cannot find a valid IntentDefinition for the provided input the returned RecognizedIntent's definition will be the DEFAULT_FALLBACK_INTENT.

        Note: this class uses strict patterns that perform exact matches of the input. This exact matching is case sensitive. You can check alternative IntentRecognitionProviders if you need to support advanced features such as partial matches.

        Note: the RegExIntentRecognitionProvider translates EntityTypes into single-word patterns. This means that the any entity will match "test", but not "test test", you can check alternative IntentRecognitionProviders if you need to support such features.

        Specified by:
        getIntent in interface IntentRecognitionProvider
        Parameters:
        input - the String representing the textual input to process and extract the intent from
        session - the XatkitSession used to access context information
        Returns:
        the RecognizedIntent matched from the provided input
